intro: Chuquiraga macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
